result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Billing Summary and Consent to Act (Atty Rifelj)
to Defendant - per 1/27/17 Dismissal. 17C 010611
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] cases #15CT490 and #16CM9 called at 9:37am. 
Defendant Bernardo G Blanco Gonzalez in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Rifelj.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appear for the State of Wisconsin. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; on case #15CT490 plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
ADA Teuber confirms Victims Rights Compliance
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses case #15CT490 Count #1 and Case #16CM9

On case #15CT490 Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve 75 days in the Jefferson County Jail, forthwith.
--Days credit for time already served: 64 days
--To pay fine of $400 + costs= $1492.  To be paid in $30 per month installments, commencing on  3/24/17 and on the 24th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 30days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--DNA sample provision
--Revocation of drivers license for 14 months 
--AODA assessment
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 14 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
--the Court orders DNA sample provision
recess: 9:54
Clerk is directed to prepare the court appointment order and any corresponding action consistent therewith
Attorney Rifelj
Status conference on January 24, 2017 at 09:30 am.
State's
It is Ordered, upon the above stipulation that Attorney Nicholas Rifelj is substituted for Attorney Jordan Lippert in the above referenced cases
from Atty. Rifelj agreeing to represent Mr. Blanco-Gonazalez
for Substitution of Attorneys
Court will address the issue of representation on 1/5/17 at 3:30 pm

[MK] cases #15CT490 and #16CM9 called at 3:46pm. 
Defendant Bernardo G Blanco Gonzalez in court, in custody, with Attorney Jordan Lippert.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Lippert, Mr. Blanco Gonzalez individually, and ADA Shock each indicate that they are waiving their right to present further evidence on the issue of Competency.  
The Court determines that the Defendant is competent.  The Court releases Mr. Blanco Gonzalez from the Court's previous Order of Commitment.  
The Court addresses Attorney Lippert's Motion to Withdraw as Defense Counsel. 
Through court staff the Court telephones Attorney Nicholas Rifelji who confirms that a family member of Mr. Blanco Gonzalez is making arrangements towards his being retained as counsel for Mr. Blanco Gonzalez.  Attorney Rifelji has an appointment to meet with Mr. Blanco Gonzalez tomorrow morning. 
After a discussion with Attorney Rifelji, the Court indicates that if Attorney Rifelji determines that he will accept an court-appointment as counse on Jefferson County cases, then the Court will accept a stipulation for substitution of attorneys.  
The Court clarifies that it is taking Attorney Lippert's Motion to Withdraw as counsel under advisement, awaiting the anticipated stipulation for substitution counsel or else notification by counsel of any change with this. 
In response to the clerk's inquiry regarding future scheduling, the Court indicates that it is not scheduling a hearing at this point; the Court leaves it to Defense counsel to notify the Court of what scheduling is needed next.  
Mr. Blanco Gonzalez raises that he has a pending Motion to Reduce the Cash Bail amount. 
The Court indicates to Mr. Blanco Gonzalez that he has Defense counsel representing him.  
recess 4:06pm.
Branch III Code of Judicial Ethics Letter
from Defendant requesting a reduction in bond
from Defendant re: Atty. Lippert's Motion to Withdraw
Motion hearing on January 5, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing on January 5, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Attorney's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel and/or Clarify Representation
Competency hearing on January 5, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
This Amended Cash Bond applies to both Cases #15CT490 and #16CM9.

Commissioner Hartley presiding for Branch II Intake: 
[MK} cases #15CT480 and #16CM9 called at 1:43pm. 
Defendant Bernardo G Blanco Gonzalez appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jordan Lippert.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Blanco Gonzalez states that he is asking that Attorney Lippert withdraw as counsel. 
Attorney Lippert indicates that he will be filing motion to withdraw as counsel.

The Court requires a $2500 Cash Bond, to apply to both cases, with the same conditions as previously ordered [which are: 
--not to drive a motor vehicle
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--to take all medications as prescribed]

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
recess 1:52pm. 


NEXT:   Competency Hearing on both cases, on 1/5/17 at 1:45pm
Defendant in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD
Defendant's Attorney's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

[Scheduled for Competency Hearing]

Cases 16CM09 and 15CT490 called together at 10:53am 
Attorney Jordan Lippert in court.  DA Susan Victoria Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court conveys to the parties that Mr. Blanco Gonzalez called into the Court's JA informing that he has a previously scheduled appointment and would be unable to attend todays hearings.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

The Court and Atty. Lippert conclude that the Court had appointed Atty. Lippert to represent Mr. Blanco Gonzalez at county expense.

On Atty. Lippert's Motion to Withdraw(submitted prior to hearing):
--further argument given by Atty. Lippert
--the Court denies Atty. Lippert request to withdraw as counsel; gives basis.

The Court issues bench warrant for Defendant in each case, body only.
recess: 11:00am
Competency hearing on July 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

Cases 15CT490 and 16CM09 called at 2:38pm [mo]
Defendant Bernardo G Blanco Gonzalez in court, in custody with Attorney Jordan Lippert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds the warrant be executed, and should be removed from any database.

As to Case 15CT490: 
ADA Shock motions that any previously imposed bond be forfeit.
Bond arguments given by ADA Shock 
The Court finds the previous bond to be in default

As to 16CM09:

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
Atty. Lippert raises competency
The Court finds reason there is reason to doubt Mr. Blanco Gonzalez's competency
The Court finds probable cause 

The Court directs the Clerk to prepare an order for competency.

The Court requires a $1100 CASH bond in case 15CT490, with conditions:
--not to drive a motor vehicle
--no possession or consumption of alcohol

The Court requires a $500 CASH bond in case 16CM09, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--take all medications as prescribed

The Court continues its previous comptency order in case 15CT490.
The Court directs Dr. Smith to conduct examination of both cases and submit report
recess:


NEXT: As to Both Cases: Competency Hearing on 7/18/16 at 11:00am

Cases 16CM9 and 15CT490 called together at 2:03pm [mo]
Defendant Bernardo G Blanco Gonzalez not in court.   Attorney Jordan Lippert appears in court. 
ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty. Lippert has no explanation for Mr. Gonzalez's non appearance.
The Court appoints Atty. Lippert on case 16CM9 as well

The Court finds probable cause to exit in Case 16CM9

The Court issues a probable cause warrant, body only.
recess: 2:07pm
